1.text: Therefore, I urge you, brethren, by the mercies of God, to present your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable to God, which is your rational offering of divine service.

2.text: Do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, so that you may prove what is the good, well-pleasing, and perfect will of God.

3.text: By the grace that was given to me, I tell everyone among you not to think [of yourselves] more highly than you should! Instead, think [of yourselves] reasonably, as God has apportioned to everyone a measure of faith.

4.text: For even as we have many members in one body, and all the members do not have the same function,

5.text: likewise we, who are many, are one body in Christ and individually members of one another.

6.text: We have different gifts according to the grace given to us: if it is prophecy, let us prophesy according to the measure of our faith.

7.text: If it is service, let us dedicate ourselves to service! He who teaches should do his teaching;

8.text: or he who exhorts his exhorting. As for the one who gives, let the giving be done with generosity. He who rules should rule with diligence and the one who shows mercy should do so with joy.

9.text: Let your love be without hypocrisy. Reject with horror what is evil. Cling to what is good.

10.text: In love for the brethren, be tenderly affectionate with one another; place the honor of others above your own.

11.text: Do not fall back in zeal; be fervent in the spirit, serving the Lord.

12.text: Rejoice in hope, endure in troubles, persevere in prayer;

13.text: contribute to the needs of the saints; look for opportunities to be hospitable.

14.text: Bless those who persecute you; bless, and do not curse!

15.text: Rejoice with those who rejoice, and weep with those who weep!

16.text: Be of the same mind one toward another. Do not set your mind on exalted things, but associate with the humble. Do not think that you are wiser than you really are.

17.text: Repay no one evil for evil. Show respect for what is honorable in the sight of all.

18.text: If it is possible, as much as is in your power, be at peace with all people.

19.text: Do not seek revenge, beloved, but let God’s wrath follow its course. As it is written, “Vengeance belongs to me; I will repay, says the Lord.”

20.text: Therefore:  If your enemy is hungry, feed him.   If he is thirsty, give him a drink;   In doing so, you will heap coals of fire on his head.

21.text: Do not be overcome by evil; instead, overcome evil with good.
